title: Lin Fan (wushu)
text:
Lin Fan (; born January 30, 1987) is a retired <a href="Wushu%20%28sport%29">wushu taolu</a> athlete from China.
Career.
Lin's first major international appearance was at the <a href="2007%20World%20Wushu%20Championships">2007 World Wushu Championships</a> in Beijing, China, where she won the first gold medal of the competition in nanquan. A year later, Lin was selected to compete at the <a href="2008%20Beijing%20Wushu%20Tournament">2008 Beijing Wushu Tournament</a> and won the gold medal in <a href="2008%20Beijing%20Wushu%20Tournament%20%E2%80%93%20Women%27s%20nanquan">women's nanquan</a>. At the <a href="2009%20World%20Games">2009 World Games</a> in Kaohsiung, Taiwan, she won in the women's nanquan and nandao combined event and a year later, won in the same event at the <a href="2010%20Asian%20Games">2010 Asian Games</a> in Gunagzhou. Her last competition was at the <a href="2011%20World%20Wushu%20Championships">2011 World Wushu Championships</a> in Ankara, Turkey where she was the world champion in nanquan.
